text: I get the same thing. The ui really needs two labels

Agreed, ideally it should allow you to choose a label for "On" and "Off" maybe an attribute like `label='[[\"Label for Checked\", \"Label for Unchecked\"]]'`  similar to the choices attribute in the choice module.
<@U22PJPGK0> should I submit this to the support request team in HubSpot or is there another place to submit issues we find in HS UI?
Thanks for bringing this up! I'm following up with dev team
Likely won't be fixed immediately but I'll let you know what we're planning
Agree that behavior is odd as-is
I think if you do it in a custom module it is better
because it doesn't have that second layer
Can you call page elements like `{{ content.featured_image }}` in a custom module? I feel like it would be more work to do it that way. I could be way off though.
i dont try to do that in custom modules
Just the elements I create n the module

Yea, because this is the blog entry page (and that pages featured image) I didnt want to do any custom modules in it that couldnt be added through a flexible column.  Thanks for verifying the issues for me <@U25PYL3Q8>
